title.narrative: Improving Girls' and Boys' Literacy and Learning Skills in Uganda Through Innovative Child Rights Based Technical Solutions

description.narrative: The project being planned aims to enhance Ugandan children?s learning competences and ability to learn to read. This will in turn provide them life skills to participate as equal members of society by developing innovative human rights based technical solu tions. The project will be implemented by UNICEF Finland NMI Makerere University and UNICEF Uganda. Innovative technical solutions learning games such as GraphoGame? will be developed into a child rights based and socio-culturally appropriate that allows c hildren to learn read. Positive messages will be included to advocate girls? rights and environmental protection. Sustainable model for dissemination will be sought to target especially remote and poor regions and the most vulnerable groups in rural Ugand a. All cooperation will be based on human rights inclusion to ensure that the possible project will reach those people who are most in need of learning aids specifically the poorest children women and children with learning difficulties The project will co nsist of two components. The 1st component?s expected result is a comprehensive analysis consisting information on: 1.) Socio-cultural and economic conditions affecting access to education and abilities to learn. 2.) Problem analysis providing information on problems related to introduction of technical learning tools,3.) Gender roles in the communities, 4.) Beneficiary/rights holder analysis including identification of vulnerable groups, 5.) Identification and definition of duty bearers including the gaps and capacities, 6.) Perceptions and attitudes towards use of technology with links to gender, 7.) Information on local languages and ethnic groups. 8.) Infrastructure and technology analysis. 9.) Definitions institutional factors and financial resources. 1 0.) Requirements by natural environment. The analysis will be conducted by two African female Researchers and will be based on interviews in 5-10 diverse villages and a desk study. The second component's expected result is the project proposal done in part icipatory spirit. Planning is based on the analysis produced by the 1st component. It will be done in two workshops organised in Uganda e-mail correspondence and Skype conferences. The proposal will be submitted to the donor on 31 May 2014. The beneficiari es of the project will be school children that include orphans and children with disabilities teachers illiterate women project partners and the donor.
